DPM_TEAM04.geometry

Class Coordinate

  • java.lang.Object
    • DPM_TEAM04.geometry.Coordinate
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectedCoordinate

    public class Coordinate
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to represent 2D points in various coordinate systems. Can also convert between coordinate systems as computationally and spacially efficient as possible.
    Author:
    KareemHalabi

    • Constructor Detail

      • Coordinate

        public Coordinate(CoordinateSystem c,
          double c1,
          double c2)
        Creates a new Coordinate in the desired coordinate system
        Parameters:
        c - desired coordinate system
        c1 - x coordinate if Cartesian, r if Polar
        c2 - y coordinate if Cartesian, theta if Polar or Compass Heading

    • Method Detail

      • setCoordinate

        public void setCoordinate(CoordinateSystem c,
                 double c1,
                 double c2)
        Reposition both dimensions of coordinate simultaneously
        Parameters:
        c - desired coordinate system
        c1 - new x coordinate if Cartesian, new r if Polar
        c2 - new y coordinate if Cartesian, new theta if Polar or Compass Heading

      • getX

        public double getX()

      • getY

        public double getY()

      • getR

        public double getR()
        Returns radial distance from origin. Always non-negative
        Returns:
        radial distance from origin

      • getTheta

        public double getTheta(CoordinateSystem unit)
        Gets the current angle of a non-origin coordinate in polar coordinate systems.
        Parameters:
        unit - Desired angular unit
        Returns:
        Angle in @param unit units. If POLAR_RAD or CARTESIAN selected: returned value is confined to 0 <= theta < 2pi with 0 rad as x axis If POLAR_DEG selected: returned value is confined to 0 <= theta < 360 with 0 deg as x axis If HEADING_DEG selected: returned value is confined to 0 <= theta < 360 with 0 deg as y axis returns NaN if point is at origin

      • getCoordinates

        public double[] getCoordinates(CoordinateSystem coordinateSystem)

        public void setR(double newR)

      • setTheta

        public void setTheta(double newTheta,
            CoordinateSystem dThetaUnit)
        Sets new angle in desired CoordinateSystem. Does nothing if CARTESIAN is selected
        Parameters:
        newTheta - new angle in @param dThetaUnit units
        dThetaUnit - desired unit for @param newTheta

      • incrementTheta

        public void incrementTheta(double dtheta,
                  CoordinateSystem dThetaUnit)
        Increments angle in desired CoordinateSystem. Does nothing if CARTESIAN is selected
        Parameters:
        dTheta - increment to apply in @param dThetaUnit units
        dThetaUnit - desired unit for @param dtheta

      • incrementCoordinate

        public void incrementCoordinate(CoordinateSystem c,
                       double dC1,
                       double dC2)
        Increment both coordinates
        Parameters:
        c - Coordinate system of dimensions
        dC1 - First dimension to increment
        dC2 - Second dimension to increment

      • distanceTo

        public double distanceTo(Coordinate dest)
        Returns shortest distance between this and @param dest
        Parameters:
        dest - Coordiante to compare to
        Returns:
        Shortest distance between this and @param dest

      • angleTo

        public double angleTo(Coordinate dest,
             double currentHeading,
             CoordinateSystem currentHeadingUnit,
             CoordinateSystem returnedUnit)
        Returns shortest angular displacement between currentHeading and @param dest
        Parameters:
        dest - Coordiante to compare to
        currentHeading - the current heading in @param currentHeadingUnit. In deg assuming input is 0 <= @param currentHeadingUnit < 360 or in rad 0 <= @param currentHeadingUnit < 2pi
        currentHeadingUnit - CoordinateSystem of @param currentHeading
        returnedUnit - Unit of returned angle
        Returns:
        shortest angular displacement between this and dest. If the two points are the same, 0 is returned

      • asPoint

        public Point asPoint()
        Returns this Coordinate as a Point object for use in LeJOS geometry classes
        Returns:
        this Coordinate as a Point object
